DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the outcomes and accuracy of implant positioning in robotic assisted total knee arthroplasty with traditional manually instrumented total knee arthroplasty.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Implant Positioning With Robotic Aided Surgery and Traditional Jig Positioning in Total Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.criteria: Patients who have knee pain and are candidates for total knee arthroplasty Patients able to consent to be included in the study Patients with previous total or partial knee arthroplasty in need of revision surgery Patients unable to or unwilling to undergo postoperative CT scans after understanding the risks and benefits
